name: Legal Notice
shortDescription: A legal notice is a formal written communication between the parties.
description: A legal notice is a formal written communication between the parties. Through a legal notice, the sender notifies the recipient about his intention of undertaking legal proceedings.

howWeWork.heading: How to get a Legal Notice drafted

content.title: Schedule Call with the Lawyer
content.description: Schedule Call and discuss with the Lawyer your Document drafting requirements

content.title: Get your Agreement Draft
content.description: Lawyer will deliver customized draft of the Document as per your requirement

content.title: Dedicated Lawyer Available
content.description: 60 Minutes of Talk time with the Lawyer for discussing requirements and changes in the draft

content.title: First Draft within 3 Days
content.description: First draft of the Document will be delivered within a maximum of 3 working days

content.title: Finalize Document
content.description: 2/3 Iterations per Document allowed to incorporate your suggestions/changes

content.title: Title of legal Notice
content.description: The title of the notice shall be written correctly. It shall include the description of the matter along with names and address of the parties. It is necessary to provide the correct address to send the notice.

content.title: Details of the parties
content.description: The notice provides the details of the sender and receiver.

content.title: Facts
content.description: The notice states the cause of the concern. It is important to write accurate facts regarding the issue. The facts are to be written in a concise and legible manner.

content.title: Sender’s demand and request
content.description: The sender writes his demands and request in the notice.  the sender can either ask for specific performance or monetary compensation for the grievances.

content.title: Compliance
content.description: The consequences of not complying with the notice are written in the notice itself. The receiver is provided a reasonable time period of 15 to 30 days to comply with the notice. If the receiver fails to comply with the notice the sender can proceed with legal action.
A notice provides for out of court settlement and negotiation, saving litigation cost.
A notice can used as a proof or can be attached to other legal documents during litigation.

productFeature.description: Senior Corporate Lawyers with 15+ years of experience

faqs.question: What is a show cause notice?
faqs.answer: Show cause notice means an order issued by a Court, Competent Authorities or an Organization asking an individual or a group of people to explain or justify a certain act.

faqs.question: Who can send a legal notice?
faqs.answer: A notice is send by an advocate on behalf of the aggrieved party.

faqs.question: What happens if someone doesn't respond to a legal notice?
faqs.answer: If the receiver does not respond to the notice in the stipulated time period, you can proceed   with legal action.

faqs.question: I have a legal notice; how can I get it reviewed by a Lawyer?
faqs.answer: ezyLegal can help you get your legal notice reviewed and provide you with the right legal guidance. You can upload your document and schedule your Consultation with an ezyLegal Lawyer.

faqs.question: What is the process of getting the notice drafted from ezyLegal?
faqs.answer: ezyLegal offers Standard and Customized Document drafts. If you chose the customized Document option, your call will be scheduled with a Lawyer to whom you can explain your specific requirements. The first draft will be delivered within 2 working days and then you would be allowed 2-3 iterations to make changes in the draft.

faqs.question: How will the Document be delivered to me?
faqs.answer: The Document when ready will be available on the ezyLegal website (www.ezylegal.in) in your secured Account. You will be notified on email and WhatsApp whenever a new version of the Document is uploaded. You can Log-in and View or Download the document.  Copy of the documents delivered by ezyLegal will always be available in your ezyLegal account forever.
